intro: Pseudanthus nematophorus, commonly known as the nematophorous pseudanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a rosette of fleshy, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming a showy inflorescence that attracts pollinators. The plant is adapted to grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
